machine_start_gcode.description: Gcode commands to be executed at the very start - separated by \n.
machine_start_gcode.default:
G28 ; Home
G1 Z15.0 F6000 ;move the platform down 15mm
;Prime the extruder
G92 E0
G1 F200 E3
G92 E0

machine_end_gcode.description: Gcode commands to be executed at the very end - separated by \n.
machine_end_gcode.default:
M104 S0
M140 S0
;Retract the filament
G92 E1
G1 E-1 F300
G28 X0 Y0
M84

material_bed_temp_wait.description: Whether to insert a command to wait until the bed temperature is reached at the start.

material_print_temp_wait.description: Whether to insert a command to wait until the nozzle temperatures are reached at the start.

material_print_temp_prepend.description: Whether to include nozzle temperature commands at the start of the gcode. When the start_gcode already contains nozzle temperature commands Cura frontend will automatically disable this setting.

material_bed_temp_prepend.description: Whether to include bed temperature commands at the start of the gcode. When the start_gcode already contains bed temperature commands Cura frontend will automatically disable this setting.

machine_width.description: The width (X-direction) of the printable area.

machine_depth.description: The depth (Y-direction) of the printable area.

machine_height.description: The height (Z-direction) of the printable area.

machine_heated_bed.description: Whether the machine has a heated bed present.

machine_center_is_zero.description: Whether the X/Y coordinates of the zero position of the printer is at the center of the printable area.

machine_extruder_count.description: Number of extruder trains. An extruder train is the combination of a feeder, bowden tube, and nozzle.

machine_nozzle_tip_outer_diameter.description: The outer diameter of the tip of the nozzle.

machine_nozzle_head_distance.description: The height difference between the tip of the nozzle and the lowest part of the print head.

machine_nozzle_expansion_angle.description: The angle between the horizontal plane and the conical part right above the tip of the nozzle.

machine_heat_zone_length.description: The distance from the tip of the nozzle in which heat from the nozzle is transfered to the filament.

machine_nozzle_heat_up_speed.description: The speed (*C/s) by which the nozzle heats up averaged over the window of normal printing temperatures and the standby temperature.

machine_nozzle_cool_down_speed.description: The speed (*C/s) by which the nozzle cools down averaged over the window of normal printing temperatures and the standby temperature.

machine_gcode_flavor.description: The type of gcode to be generated.

machine_disallowed_areas.description: A list of polygons with areas the print head is not allowed to enter.

machine_platform_offset.description: Where to display the platform mesh.

machine_head_polygon.description: A 2D silhouette of the print head.

machine_head_with_fans_polygon.description: A 2D silhouette of the print head.

gantry_height.description: The height difference between the tip of the nozzle and the gantry system (X and Y axes).

machine_nozzle_size.label: Nozzle Diameter
machine_nozzle_size.description: The inner diameter of the nozzle. Change this setting when using a non-standard nozzle size.

layer_height.label: Layer Height
layer_height.description: The height of each layer in mm. Higher values produce faster prints in lower resolution, lower values produce slower prints in higher resolution.

layer_height_0.label: Initial Layer Height
layer_height_0.description: The height of the initial layer in mm. A thicker initial layer makes adhesion to the build plate easier.

line_width.label: Line Width
line_width.description: Width of a single line. Generally, the width of each line should correspond to the width of the nozzle. However, slightly reducing this value could produce better prints.

wall_line_width.label: Wall Line Width
wall_line_width.description: Width of a single wall line.

wall_line_width_0.label: Outer Wall Line Width
wall_line_width_0.description: Width of the outermost wall line. By lowering this value, higher levels of detail can be printed.

wall_line_width_x.label: Inner Wall(s) Line Width
wall_line_width_x.description: Width of a single wall line for all wall lines except the outermost one.

skin_line_width.label: Top/bottom Line Width
skin_line_width.description: Width of a single top/bottom line.

infill_line_width.label: Infill Line Width
infill_line_width.description: Width of a single infill line.

skirt_line_width.label: Skirt Line Width
skirt_line_width.description: Width of a single skirt line.

support_line_width.label: Support Line Width
support_line_width.description: Width of a single support structure line.

support_roof_line_width.label: Support Roof Line Width
support_roof_line_width.description: Width of a single support roof line.

wall_thickness.label: Wall Thickness
wall_thickness.description: The thickness of the outside walls in the horizontal direction. This value divided by the wall line width defines the number of walls.

wall_line_count.label: Wall Line Count
wall_line_count.description: The number of walls. When calculated by the wall thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.
wall_line_count.inherit_function: 1 if magic_spiralize else max(1, round((wall_thickness - wall_line_width_0) / wall_line_width_x) + 1)

top_bottom_thickness.label: Top/Bottom Thickness
top_bottom_thickness.description: The thickness of the top/bottom layers in the print. This value divided by the layer height defines the number of top/bottom layers.

top_thickness.label: Top Thickness
top_thickness.description: The thickness of the top layers in the print. This value divided by the layer height defines the number of top layers.

top_layers.label: Top Layers
top_layers.description: The number of top layers. When calculated by the top thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.

bottom_thickness.label: Bottom Thickness
bottom_thickness.description: The thickness of the bottom layers in the print. This value divided by the layer height defines the number of bottom layers.

bottom_layers.label: Bottom Layers
bottom_layers.description: The number of bottom layers. When calculated by the bottom thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.

top_bottom_pattern.label: Top/Bottom Pattern
top_bottom_pattern.description: The pattern of the top/bottom layers.

alternate_extra_perimeter.label: Alternate Extra Wall
alternate_extra_perimeter.description: Prints an extra wall at every other layer. This way infill gets caught between these extra walls, resulting in stronger prints.

remove_overlapping_walls_enabled.label: Remove Overlapping Wall Parts
remove_overlapping_walls_enabled.description: Remove parts of a wall which share an overlap which would result in overextrusion in some places. These overlaps occur in thin parts and sharp corners in models.

remove_overlapping_walls_0_enabled.label: Remove Overlapping Outer Wall Parts
remove_overlapping_walls_0_enabled.description: Remove parts of an outer wall which share an overlap which would result in overextrusion in some places. These overlaps occur in thin pieces in a model and sharp corners.

remove_overlapping_walls_x_enabled.label: Remove Overlapping Inner Wall Parts
remove_overlapping_walls_x_enabled.description: Remove parts of an inner wall that would otherwise overlap and cause over-extrusion. These overlaps occur in thin pieces in a model and sharp corners.

fill_perimeter_gaps.label: Fill Gaps Between Walls
fill_perimeter_gaps.description: Fills the gaps between walls when overlapping inner wall parts are removed.

travel_compensate_overlapping_walls_enab.label: Compensate Wall Overlaps
travel_compensate_overlapping_walls_enab.description: Compensate the flow for parts of a wall being printed where there is already a wall in place.

xy_offset.label: Horizontal Expansion
xy_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to all polygons in each layer. Positive values can compensate for too big holes; negative values can compensate for too small holes.

z_seam_type.label: Z Seam Alignment
z_seam_type.description: Starting point of each path in a layer. When paths in consecutive layers start at the same point a vertical seam may show on the print. When aligning these at the back, the seam is easiest to remove. When placed randomly the inaccuracies at the paths' start will be less noticeable. When taking the shortest path the print will be quicker.

skin_no_small_gaps_heuristic.label: Ignore Small Z Gaps
skin_no_small_gaps_heuristic.description: When the model has small vertical gaps, about 5% extra computation time can be spent on generating top and bottom skin in these narrow spaces. In such case, disable the setting.

infill_sparse_density.label: Infill Density
infill_sparse_density.description: Adjusts the density of infill of the print.

infill_line_distance.label: Line Distance
infill_line_distance.description: Distance between the printed infill lines. This setting is calculated by the infill density and the infill line width.

infill_pattern.label: Infill Pattern
infill_pattern.description: The pattern of the infill material of the print. The line and zig zag infill swap direction on alternate layers, reducing material cost. The grid, triangle and concentric patterns are fully printed every layer.

infill_overlap.label: Infill Overlap
infill_overlap.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

infill_wipe_dist.label: Infill Wipe Distance
infill_wipe_dist.description: Distance of a travel move inserted after every infill line, to make the infill stick to the walls better. This option is similar to infill overlap, but without extrusion and only on one end of the infill line.

infill_sparse_thickness.label: Infill Layer Thickness
infill_sparse_thickness.description: The thickness per layer of infill material. This value should always be a multiple of the layer height and is otherwise rounded.

infill_before_walls.label: Infill Before Walls
infill_before_walls.description: Print the infill before printing the walls. Printing the walls first may lead to more accurate walls, but overhangs print worse. Printing the infill first leads to sturdier walls, but the infill pattern might sometimes show through the surface.

material_flow_dependent_temperature.label: Auto Temperature
material_flow_dependent_temperature.description: Change the temperature for each layer automatically with the average flow speed of that layer.

material_print_temperature.label: Printing Temperature
material_print_temperature.description: The temperature used for printing. Set at 0 to pre-heat the printer manually.

material_flow_temp_graph.label: Flow Temperature Graph
material_flow_temp_graph.description: Data linking material flow (in mm3 per second) to temperature (degrees Celsius).

material_extrusion_cool_down_speed.label: Extrusion Cool Down Speed Modifier
material_extrusion_cool_down_speed.description: The extra speed by which the nozzle cools while extruding. The same value is used to signify the heat up speed lost when heating up while extruding.

material_bed_temperature.label: Bed Temperature
material_bed_temperature.description: The temperature used for the heated bed. Set at 0 to pre-heat the printer manually.

material_diameter.label: Diameter
material_diameter.description: Adjusts the diameter of the filament used. Match this value with the diameter of the used filament.

material_flow.label: Flow
material_flow.description: Flow compensation: the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

retraction_enable.label: Enable Retraction
retraction_enable.description: Retract the filament when the nozzle is moving over a non-printed area.

retraction_amount.label: Retraction Distance
retraction_amount.description: The length of material retracted during a retraction move.

retraction_speed.label: Retraction Speed
retraction_speed.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted and primed during a retraction move.

retraction_retract_speed.label: Retraction Retract Speed
retraction_retract_speed.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted during a retraction move.

retraction_prime_speed.label: Retraction Prime Speed
retraction_prime_speed.description: The speed at which the filament is primed during a retraction move.

retraction_extra_prime_amount.label: Retraction Extra Prime Amount
retraction_extra_prime_amount.description: Some material can ooze away during a travel move, which can be compensated for here.

retraction_min_travel.label: Retraction Minimum Travel
retraction_min_travel.description: The minimum distance of travel needed for a retraction to happen at all. This helps to get fewer retractions in a small area.

retraction_count_max.label: Maximum Retraction Count
retraction_count_max.description: This setting limits the number of retractions occurring within the minimum extrusion distance window. Further retractions within this window will be ignored. This avoids retracting repeatedly on the same piece of filament, as that can flatten the filament and cause grinding issues.

retraction_extrusion_window.label: Minimum Extrusion Distance Window
retraction_extrusion_window.description: The window in which the maximum retraction count is enforced. This value should be approximately the same as the retraction distance, so that effectively the number of times a retraction passes the same patch of material is limited.

retraction_hop.label: Z Hop when Retracting
retraction_hop.description: Whenever a retraction is done, the build plate is lowered to create clearance between the nozzle and the print. It prevents the nozzle from hitting the print during travel moves, reducing the chance to knock the print from the build plate.

speed_print.label: Print Speed
speed_print.description: The speed at which printing happens.

speed_infill.label: Infill Speed
speed_infill.description: The speed at which infill is printed.

speed_wall.label: Wall Speed
speed_wall.description: The speed at which the walls are printed.

speed_wall_0.label: Outer Wall Speed
speed_wall_0.description: The speed at which the outermost walls are printed. Printing the outer wall at a lower speed improves the final skin quality. However, having a large difference between the inner wall speed and the outer wall speed will effect quality in a negative way.

speed_wall_x.label: Inner Wall Speed
speed_wall_x.description: The speed at which all inner walls are printed Printing the inner wall faster than the outer wall will reduce printing time. It works well to set this in between the outer wall speed and the infill speed.

speed_topbottom.label: Top/Bottom Speed
speed_topbottom.description: The speed at which top/bottom layers are printed.

speed_support.label: Support Speed
speed_support.description: The speed at which the support structure is printed. Printing support at higher speeds can greatly reduce printing time. The surface quality of the support structure is not important since it is removed after printing.

speed_support_lines.label: Support Wall Speed
speed_support_lines.description: The speed at which the walls of support are printed. Printing the walls at lower speeds improves stability.

speed_support_roof.label: Support Roof Speed
speed_support_roof.description: The speed at which the roofs of support are printed. Printing the support roof at lower speeds can improve overhang quality.

speed_travel.label: Travel Speed
speed_travel.description: The speed at which travel moves are made.

speed_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Speed
speed_layer_0.description: The print speed for the initial layer. A lower value is advised to improve adhesion to the build plate.

skirt_speed.label: Skirt Speed
skirt_speed.description: The speed at which the skirt and brim are printed. Normally this is done at the initial layer speed, but sometimes you might want to print the skirt at a different speed.

speed_slowdown_layers.label: Number of Slower Layers
speed_slowdown_layers.description: The first few layers are printed slower than the rest of the object, to get better adhesion to the build plate and improve the overall success rate of prints. The speed is gradually increased over these layers.

retraction_combing.label: Enable Combing
retraction_combing.description: Combing keeps the nozzle within already printed areas when traveling. This results in slightly longer travel moves but reduces the need for retractions. If combing is disabled, the material will retract and the nozzle moves in a straight line to the next point.

travel_avoid_other_parts.label: Avoid Printed Parts
travel_avoid_other_parts.description: The nozzle avoids already printed parts when traveling. This option is only available when combing is enabled.

travel_avoid_distance.label: Avoid Distance
travel_avoid_distance.description: The distance between the nozzle and already printed parts when avoiding during travel moves.

cool_fan_enabled.label: Enable Cooling Fans
cool_fan_enabled.description: Enables the cooling fans while printing. The fans improve print quality on layers with short layer times and bridging / overhangs.

cool_fan_speed.label: Fan Speed
cool_fan_speed.description: The speed at which the cooling fans spin.

cool_fan_speed_min.label: Regular Fan Speed
cool_fan_speed_min.description: The speed at which the fans spin before hitting the threshold. When a layer prints faster than the threshold, the fan speed gradually inclines towards the maximum fan speed.

cool_fan_speed_max.label: Maximum Fan Speed
cool_fan_speed_max.description: The speed at which the fans spin on the minimum layer time. The fan speed gradually increases between the regular fan speed and maximum fan speed when the threshold is hit.

cool_min_layer_time_fan_speed_max.label: Regular/Maximum Fan Speed Threshold
cool_min_layer_time_fan_speed_max.description: The layer time which sets the threshold between regular fan speed and maximum fan speed. Layers that print slower than this time use regular fan speed. For faster layers the fan speed gradually increases towards the maximum fan speed.

cool_fan_full_at_height.label: Regular Fan Speed at Height
cool_fan_full_at_height.description: The height at which the fans spin on regular fan speed. At the layers below the fan speed gradually increases from zero to regular fan speed.

cool_fan_full_layer.label: Regular Fan Speed at Layer
cool_fan_full_layer.description: The layer at which the fans spin on regular fan speed. If regular fan speed at height is set, this value is calculated and rounded to a whole number.

cool_min_layer_time.label: Minimum Layer Time
cool_min_layer_time.description: The minimum time spent in a layer. This forces the printer to slow down, to at least spend the time set here in one layer. This allows the printed material to cool down properly before printing the next layer.

cool_min_speed.label: Minimum Speed
cool_min_speed.description: The minimum print speed, despite slowing down due to the minimum layer time. When the printer would slow down too much, the pressure in the nozzle would be too low and result in bad print quality.

cool_lift_head.label: Lift Head
cool_lift_head.description: When the minimum speed is hit because of minimum layer time, lift the head away from the print and wait the extra time until the minimum layer time is reached.

support_enable.label: Enable Support
support_enable.description: Enable support structures. These structures support parts of the model with severe overhangs.

support_type.label: Placement
support_type.description: Adjusts the placement of the support structures. The placement can be set to touching build plate or everywhere. When set to everywhere the support structures will also be printed on the model.

support_angle.label: Overhang Angle
support_angle.description: The minimum angle of overhangs for which support is added. At a value of 0° all overhangs are supported, 90° will not provide any support.

support_pattern.label: Support Pattern
support_pattern.description: The pattern of the support structures of the print. The different options available result in sturdy or easy to remove support.

support_connect_zigzags.label: Connect ZigZags
support_connect_zigzags.description: Connect the ZigZags. This will increase the strength of the zig zag support structure.

support_infill_rate.label: Support Density
support_infill_rate.description: Adjusts the density of the support structure. A higher value results in better overhangs, but the supports are harder to remove.

support_line_distance.label: Support Line Distance
support_line_distance.description: Distance between the printed support structure lines. This setting is calculated by the support density.

support_xy_distance.label: X/Y Distance
support_xy_distance.description: Distance of the support structure from the print in the X/Y directions.

support_z_distance.label: Z Distance
support_z_distance.description: Distance from the top/bottom of the support structure to the print. This gap provides clearance to remove the supports after the model is printed. This value is rounded down to a multiple of the layer height.

support_top_distance.label: Top Distance
support_top_distance.description: Distance from the top of the support to the print.

support_bottom_distance.label: Bottom Distance
support_bottom_distance.description: Distance from the print to the bottom of the support.

support_bottom_stair_step_height.label: Stair Step Height
support_bottom_stair_step_height.description: The height of the steps of the stair-like bottom of support resting on the model. A low value makes the support harder to remove, but too high values can lead to unstable support structures.

support_join_distance.label: Join Distance
support_join_distance.description: The maximum distance between support structures in the X/Y directions. When seperate structures are closer together than this value, the structures merge into one.

support_offset.label: Horizontal Expansion
support_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to all support polygons in each layer. Positive values can smooth out the support areas and result in more sturdy support.

support_area_smoothing.label: Area Smoothing
support_area_smoothing.description: Maximum distance in the X/Y directions of a line segment which is to be smoothed out. Ragged lines are introduced by the join distance and support bridge, which cause the machine to resonate. Smoothing the support areas won't cause them to break with the constraints, except it might change the overhang.

support_roof_enable.label: Enable Support Roof
support_roof_enable.description: Generate a dense top skin at the top of the support on which the model is printed.

support_roof_height.label: Support Roof Thickness
support_roof_height.description: The thickness of the support roofs.

support_roof_density.label: Support Roof Density
support_roof_density.description: Adjusts the density of the roof of the support structure. A higher value results in better overhangs, but the supports are harder to remove.

support_roof_line_distance.label: Support Roof Line Distance
support_roof_line_distance.description: Distance between the printed support roof lines. This setting is calculated by the support roof Density, but can be adjusted separately.

support_roof_pattern.label: Support Roof Pattern
support_roof_pattern.description: The pattern with which the top of the support is printed.

support_use_towers.label: Use Towers
support_use_towers.description: Use specialized towers to support tiny overhang areas. These towers have a larger diameter than the region they support. Near the overhang the towers' diameter decreases, forming a roof.

support_tower_diameter.label: Tower Diameter
support_tower_diameter.description: The diameter of a special tower.

support_minimal_diameter.label: Minimum Diameter
support_minimal_diameter.description: Minimum diameter in the X/Y directions of a small area which is to be supported by a specialized support tower.

support_tower_roof_angle.label: Tower Roof Angle
support_tower_roof_angle.description: The angle of a rooftop of a tower. A higher value results in pointed tower roofs, a lower value results in flattened tower roofs.

adhesion_type.label: Type
adhesion_type.description: Different options that help to improve both priming your extrusion and adhesion to the build plate. Brim adds a single layer flat area around the base of your object to prevent warping. Raft adds a thick grid with a roof below the object. Skirt is a line printed around the object, but not connected to the model.

skirt_line_count.label: Skirt Line Count
skirt_line_count.description: Multiple skirt lines help to prime your extrusion better for small objects. Setting this to 0 will disable the skirt.

skirt_gap.label: Skirt Distance
skirt_gap.description:
The horizontal distance between the skirt and the first layer of the print.
This is the minimum distance, multiple skirt lines will extend outwards from this distance.

skirt_minimal_length.label: Skirt Minimum Length
skirt_minimal_length.description: The minimum length of the skirt. If this length is not reached by the skirt line count, more skirt lines will be added until the minimum length is reached. Note: If the line count is set to 0 this is ignored.

brim_width.label: Brim Width
brim_width.description: The distance from the model to the outermost brim line. A larger brim enhances adhesion to the build plate, but also reduces the effective print area.

brim_line_count.label: Brim Line Count
brim_line_count.description: The number of lines used for a brim. More brim lines enhance adhesion to the build plate, but also reduces the effective print area.

raft_margin.label: Raft Extra Margin
raft_margin.description: If the raft is enabled, this is the extra raft area around the object which is also given a raft. Increasing this margin will create a stronger raft while using more material and leaving less area for your print.

raft_airgap.label: Raft Air-gap
raft_airgap.description: The gap between the final raft layer and the first layer of the object. Only the first layer is raised by this amount to lower the bonding between the raft layer and the object. Makes it easier to peel off the raft.

layer_0_z_overlap.label: Initial Layer Z Overlap
layer_0_z_overlap.description: Make the first and second layer of the object overlap in the Z direction to compensate for the filament lost in the airgap. All models above the first model layer will be shifted down by this amount.

raft_surface_layers.label: Raft Top Layers
raft_surface_layers.description: The number of top layers on top of the 2nd raft layer. These are fully filled layers that the object sits on. 2 layers result in a smoother top surface than 1.

raft_surface_thickness.label: Raft Top Layer Thickness
raft_surface_thickness.description: Layer thickness of the top raft layers.

raft_surface_line_width.label: Raft Top Line Width
raft_surface_line_width.description: Width of the lines in the top surface of the raft. These can be thin lines so that the top of the raft becomes smooth.

raft_surface_line_spacing.label: Raft Top Spacing
raft_surface_line_spacing.description: The distance between the raft lines for the top raft layers. The spacing should be equal to the line width, so that the surface is solid.

raft_interface_thickness.label: Raft Middle Thickness
raft_interface_thickness.description: Layer thickness of the middle raft layer.

raft_interface_line_width.label: Raft Middle Line Width
raft_interface_line_width.description: Width of the lines in the middle raft layer. Making the second layer extrude more causes the lines to stick to the bed.

raft_interface_line_spacing.label: Raft Middle Spacing
raft_interface_line_spacing.description: The distance between the raft lines for the middle raft layer. The spacing of the middle should be quite wide, while being dense enough to support the top raft layers.

raft_base_thickness.label: Raft Base Thickness
raft_base_thickness.description: Layer thickness of the base raft layer. This should be a thick layer which sticks firmly to the printer bed.

raft_base_line_width.label: Raft Base Line Width
raft_base_line_width.description: Width of the lines in the base raft layer. These should be thick lines to assist in bed adhesion.

raft_base_line_spacing.label: Raft Line Spacing
raft_base_line_spacing.description: The distance between the raft lines for the base raft layer. Wide spacing makes for easy removal of the raft from the build plate.

raft_speed.label: Raft Print Speed
raft_speed.description: The speed at which the raft is printed.

raft_surface_speed.label: Raft Surface Print Speed
raft_surface_speed.description: The speed at which the surface raft layers are printed. These should be printed a bit slower, so that the nozzle can slowly smooth out adjacent surface lines.

raft_interface_speed.label: Raft Interface Print Speed
raft_interface_speed.description: The speed at which the interface raft layer is printed. This should be printed quite slowly, as the volume of material coming out of the nozzle is quite high.

raft_base_speed.label: Raft Base Print Speed
raft_base_speed.description: The speed at which the base raft layer is printed. This should be printed quite slowly, as the volume of material coming out of the nozzle is quite high.

raft_fan_speed.label: Raft Fan Speed
raft_fan_speed.description: The fan speed for the raft.

raft_surface_fan_speed.label: Raft Surface Fan Speed
raft_surface_fan_speed.description: The fan speed for the surface raft layers.

raft_interface_fan_speed.label: Raft Interface Fan Speed
raft_interface_fan_speed.description: The fan speed for the interface raft layer.

raft_base_fan_speed.label: Raft Base Fan Speed
raft_base_fan_speed.description: The fan speed for the base raft layer.

meshfix_union_all.label: Union Overlapping Volumes
meshfix_union_all.description: Ignore the internal geometry arising from overlapping volumes and print the volumes as one. This may cause internal cavities to disappear.

meshfix_union_all_remove_holes.label: Remove All Holes
meshfix_union_all_remove_holes.description: Remove the holes in each layer and keep only the outside shape. This will ignore any invisible internal geometry. However, it also ignores layer holes which can be viewed from above or below.

meshfix_extensive_stitching.label: Extensive Stitching
meshfix_extensive_stitching.description: Extensive stitching tries to stitch up open holes in the mesh by closing the hole with touching polygons. This option can introduce a lot of processing time.

meshfix_keep_open_polygons.label: Keep Disconnected Faces
meshfix_keep_open_polygons.description: Normally Cura tries to stitch up small holes in the mesh and remove parts of a layer with big holes. Enabling this option keeps those parts which cannot be stitched. This option should be used as a last resort option when everything else fails to produce proper GCode.

print_sequence.label: Print Sequence
print_sequence.description: Whether to print all objects one layer at a time or to wait for one object to finish, before moving on to the next. One at a time mode is only possible if all models are separated in such a way that the whole print head can move in between and all models are lower than the distance between the nozzle and the X/Y axes.

magic_mesh_surface_mode.label: Surface Mode
magic_mesh_surface_mode.description: Print the surface instead of the volume. No infill, no top/bottom skin, just a single wall of which the middle coincides with the surface of the mesh. It's also possible to do both: print the insides of a closed volume as normal, but print all polygons not part of a closed volume as surface.

magic_spiralize.label: Spiralize Outer Contour
magic_spiralize.description: Spiralize smooths out the Z move of the outer edge. This will create a steady Z increase over the whole print. This feature turns a solid object into a single walled print with a solid bottom. This feature used to be called Joris in older versions.

draft_shield_enabled.label: Enable Draft Shield
draft_shield_enabled.description: This will create a wall around the object, which traps (hot) air and shields against exterior airflow. Especially useful for materials which warp easily.

draft_shield_dist.label: Draft Shield X/Y Distance
draft_shield_dist.description: Distance of the draft shield from the print, in the X/Y directions.

draft_shield_height_limitation.label: Draft Shield Limitation
draft_shield_height_limitation.description: Set the height of the draft shield. Choose to print the draft shield at the full height of the object or at a limited height.

draft_shield_height.label: Draft Shield Height
draft_shield_height.description: Height limitation of the draft shield. Above this height no draft shield will be printed.

coasting_enable.label: Enable Coasting
coasting_enable.description: Coasting replaces the last part of an extrusion path with a travel path. The oozed material is used to print the last piece of the extrusion path in order to reduce stringing.

coasting_volume.label: Coasting Volume
coasting_volume.description: The volume otherwise oozed. This value should generally be close to the nozzle diameter cubed.

coasting_min_volume.label: Minimum Volume Before Coasting
coasting_min_volume.description: The lowest volume an extrusion path should have before allowing coasting. For smaller extrusion paths, less pressure has been built up in the bowden tube and so the coasted volume is scaled linearly. This value should always be larger than the Coasting Volume.

coasting_speed.label: Coasting Speed
coasting_speed.description: The speed by which to move during coasting, relative to the speed of the extrusion path. A value slightly under 100% is advised, since during the coasting move the pressure in the bowden tube drops.

skin_outline_count.label: Extra Skin Wall Count
skin_outline_count.description: Replaces the outermost part of the top/bottom pattern with a number of concentric lines. Using one or two lines improves roofs that start on infill material.

skin_alternate_rotation.label: Alternate Skin Rotation
skin_alternate_rotation.description: Alternate the direction in which the top/bottom layers are printed. Normally they are printed diagonally only. This setting adds the X-only and Y-only directions.

support_conical_enabled.label: Conical Support
support_conical_enabled.description: Experimental feature: Make support areas smaller at the bottom than at the overhang.

support_conical_angle.label: Cone Angle
support_conical_angle.description: The angle of the tilt of conical support. With 0 degrees being vertical, and 90 degrees being horizontal. Smaller angles cause the support to be more sturdy, but consist of more material. Negative angles cause the base of the support to be wider than the top.

support_conical_min_width.label: Cone Minimal Width
support_conical_min_width.description: Minimal width to which the base of the conical support area is reduced. Small widths can lead to unstable support structures.

magic_fuzzy_skin_enabled.label: Fuzzy Skin
magic_fuzzy_skin_enabled.description: Randomly jitter while printing the outer wall, so that the surface has a rough and fuzzy look.

magic_fuzzy_skin_thickness.label: Fuzzy Skin Thickness
magic_fuzzy_skin_thickness.description: The width within which to jitter. It's advised to keep this below the outer wall width, since the inner walls are unaltered.

magic_fuzzy_skin_point_density.label: Fuzzy Skin Density
magic_fuzzy_skin_point_density.description: The average density of points introduced on each polygon in a layer. Note that the original points of the polygon are discarded, so a low density results in a reduction of the resolution.

magic_fuzzy_skin_point_dist.label: Fuzzy Skin Point Distance
magic_fuzzy_skin_point_dist.description: The average distance between the random points introduced on each line segment. Note that the original points of the polygon are discarded, so a high smoothness results in a reduction of the resolution. This value must be higher than half the Fuzzy Skin Thickness.

wireframe_enabled.label: Wire Printing
wireframe_enabled.description: Print only the outside surface with a sparse webbed structure, printing 'in thin air'. This is realized by horizontally printing the contours of the model at given Z intervals which are connected via upward and diagonally downward lines.

wireframe_height.label: WP Connection Height
wireframe_height.description: The height of the upward and diagonally downward lines between two horizontal parts. This determines the overall density of the net structure. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_roof_inset.label: WP Roof Inset Distance
wireframe_roof_inset.description: The distance covered when making a connection from a roof outline inward. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_printspeed.label: WP speed
wireframe_printspeed.description: Speed at which the nozzle moves when extruding material. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_printspeed_bottom.label: WP Bottom Printing Speed
wireframe_printspeed_bottom.description: Speed of printing the first layer, which is the only layer touching the build platform. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_printspeed_up.label: WP Upward Printing Speed
wireframe_printspeed_up.description: Speed of printing a line upward 'in thin air'. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_printspeed_down.label: WP Downward Printing Speed
wireframe_printspeed_down.description: Speed of printing a line diagonally downward. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_printspeed_flat.label: WP Horizontal Printing Speed
wireframe_printspeed_flat.description: Speed of printing the horizontal contours of the object. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_flow.label: WP Flow
wireframe_flow.description: Flow compensation: the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_flow_connection.label: WP Connection Flow
wireframe_flow_connection.description: Flow compensation when going up or down. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_flow_flat.label: WP Flat Flow
wireframe_flow_flat.description: Flow compensation when printing flat lines. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_top_delay.label: WP Top Delay
wireframe_top_delay.description: Delay time after an upward move, so that the upward line can harden. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_bottom_delay.label: WP Bottom Delay
wireframe_bottom_delay.description: Delay time after a downward move. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_flat_delay.label: WP Flat Delay
wireframe_flat_delay.description: Delay time between two horizontal segments. Introducing such a delay can cause better adhesion to previous layers at the connection points, while too long delays cause sagging. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_up_half_speed.label: WP Ease Upward
wireframe_up_half_speed.description:
Distance of an upward move which is extruded with half speed.
This can cause better adhesion to previous layers, while not heating the material in those layers too much. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_top_jump.label: WP Knot Size
wireframe_top_jump.description: Creates a small knot at the top of an upward line, so that the consecutive horizontal layer has a better chance to connect to it. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_fall_down.label: WP Fall Down
wireframe_fall_down.description: Distance with which the material falls down after an upward extrusion. This distance is compensated for. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_drag_along.label: WP Drag along
wireframe_drag_along.description: Distance with which the material of an upward extrusion is dragged along with the diagonally downward extrusion. This distance is compensated for. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_strategy.label: WP Strategy
wireframe_strategy.description: Strategy for making sure two consecutive layers connect at each connection point. Retraction lets the upward lines harden in the right position, but may cause filament grinding. A knot can be made at the end of an upward line to heighten the chance of connecting to it and to let the line cool; however, it may require slow printing speeds. Another strategy is to compensate for the sagging of the top of an upward line; however, the lines won't always fall down as predicted.

wireframe_straight_before_down.label: WP Straighten Downward Lines
wireframe_straight_before_down.description: Percentage of a diagonally downward line which is covered by a horizontal line piece. This can prevent sagging of the top most point of upward lines. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_roof_fall_down.label: WP Roof Fall Down
wireframe_roof_fall_down.description: The distance which horizontal roof lines printed 'in thin air' fall down when being printed. This distance is compensated for. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_roof_drag_along.label: WP Roof Drag Along
wireframe_roof_drag_along.description: The distance of the end piece of an inward line which gets dragged along when going back to the outer outline of the roof. This distance is compensated for. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_roof_outer_delay.label: WP Roof Outer Delay
wireframe_roof_outer_delay.description: Time spent at the outer perimeters of hole which is to become a roof. Longer times can ensure a better connection. Only applies to Wire Printing.

wireframe_nozzle_clearance.label: WP Nozzle Clearance
wireframe_nozzle_clearance.description: Distance between the nozzle and horizontally downward lines. Larger clearance results in diagonally downward lines with a less steep angle, which in turn results in less upward connections with the next layer. Only applies to Wire Printing.
